direction.raw_text: Next to book shelves and an upright piano, with sheet music on the stand - CHOPIN. There is also a dining room table with leftovers from an abandoned meal - strawberries and cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a warm night, the MAN is asleep with the same
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now pregnant, no sheets on the bed. The MAN is restless and wakes. A distant RUMBLING, indistinct - the MAN swings his feet off of the bed and goes to the window, anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN is in his shorts, sweating, putting a plug in the bath and turning on the taps as far as they will go. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears in the doorway in a nightdress and leans against the door frame watching, blearily, cradling her pregnant belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why are you taking a bath? MAN. I'm not. The WOMAN takes off her nightdress and goes to the bath. WOMAN. You'll sleep better. He looks at her, surprised she's misunderstood. MAN. I'm not! Put your clothes back on. She sees he's looking out the window now - there's an eery rose-colored glow of distant fire through the glass - and distant shouts and screams... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it? What's happening? END OF FLASHBACK: TITLE: THE ROAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of about forty and a BOY of ten are asleep, camped on a tarp under a rock ledge, the blackened chasm of a burnt valley spread out below. It is the same man seen earlier - but ten years older, thinner, malnourished, with a thick beard. They are both emaciated and exhausted, their faces and hands coated in grime and soot from the burned, blackened landscape around them. Ash falls on the tarp, which is bright synthetic blue, the only color in sight. The MAN is woken by something, he instinctively reaches out to touch the BOY, his hand rests on his chest and rises and falls with each of the sleeping BOY's breaths. There is a low RUMBLE, the ground starts to TREMBLE and the BOY wakes. BOY. Papa? (NO REPLY.) Papa? MAN. Shh. It's okay. BOY. What is it, Papa? They listen as it grows NEARER and LOUDER, everything
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tree roots GROANING and SPLITTING, until it passes between them with a ROAR like a subway train right beneath them. The BOY is now clinging to the MAN and crying, his head buried against his chest in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shh. It's all right. It's all right. It's gone. BOY. What was it, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It was an earthquake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the burnt, barren landscape, through swirls of soft ash and smoggy air the MAN appears dressed in a filthy old PARKA with the hood up, a knapsack on his back, pushing a rusted shopping CART with a bicycle mirror clamped to the handle and the BLUE tarp now covering it's load. The little BOY, similarly dressed with a KNAPSACK on his back, shuffles through the ash at his side - like Depression-era Dust Bowl homeless. There is a flicker of lightning over head, then more, but no thunder. MAN. (V.0.) The clocks stopped at one seventeen one morning. There was a long shear of bright light, then a series of low concussions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broken asphalt, the earthquake has caused a large FISSURE to open up ALONGSIDE the road, with a sheer drop. THE MAN and THE BOY edge past burnt trees and scrub. MAN. (V.0.) Within a year there were fires on the ridges and deranged chanting. The screams of the murdered. By day the dead impaled on spikes along the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They trudge past a vast lake filled with dead trees... MAN. (V.0.) I think it's October but I can't be sure. I haven't kept a calender for 5 years. EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE - DAY They truck along with the trolley through the fog, the ghostly shapes of dead trees on either side and the shapes of barren mountains in the background... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) Each day is more gray than the one before. Each night is darker - beyond darkness. The world gets colder week by week as the planet slowly dies. No animals have survived. All the crops are long gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tree falls behind them with a WHUMP and they jump... MAN (V.0.) Someday all the trees in the world will have fallen. EXT. GAS STATION - DAY The MAN forages for petrol, checking the nozzle of the pumps, rummaging through empty oil cans, he upends a bin to get at the empty oil bottles. The BOY picks up a phone on a wall and listens to the dead earpiece. MAN. (V.0.) The roads are peopled by refugees towing carts and road gangs carrying weapons, looking for fuel and food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They head down a long straight road towards a dark, forbidding looking tunnel - a turnpike. MAN. (V.0.) There has been cannibalism. Cannibalism is the great fear. EXT. CITY - DAY They emerge before a view of a deserted city-state... EXT. MALL - DAY They forage in a deserted mall... There are skeletons and human bones here and there. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) Mostly I worry about food. Always food. Food and our shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - the BOY examines the head of a moose mounted on a wall in a SEARS hunting store. MAN. (V.0.) (CONT'D) Sometimes I tell the boy old stories of courage and justice - difficult as they are to remember. All I know is the child is my warrant and if he is not the word of God, then God never spoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. RIDGE/ CAMPSITE - (CAMP 2) - EVENING They are camped high up on the ridge of a mountainside. There is a camp fire with wet clothes hanging to dry on sticks beside it. The MAN is erecting the tarp over string tied between two sticks stuck in the ground. The BOY is sitting lighting a lantern using the scavenged oil inside the makeshift tent, his shadow stark against the illuminated tarp. BOY. Now you can read me a story. He gets out a BOOK and looks at the pictures in the lamplight. The MAN reads him a story... EXT. RIDGE/CAMPSITE - (CAMP 2) - NIGHT The MAN awakens bathed in firey light as if the sun has come out. There is pale gray snow all around him with a quivering orange glow. He gets up to investigate, looks to the line of trees up the ridge where a FOREST FIRE is burning, CRACKLING in the distance. He stands staring at the fire, the warmth and light moving him, enlivening him and not frightening him at all. The BOY has got up and appears at his side, yawning. He looks at the sky at a single gray SNOWFLAKE drifting down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's snowing! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's like it used to be when the sun came out. The BOY catches the snowflake in his hand, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They travel along the road through drifting wood smoke, smoke pouring off the ground like mist and thin black trees burning like candles on the snowy ridge. They reach a spot where fire has crossed the road melting the tarmac. Their feet stick in the molten tarmac, it sucks at their shoes and they stop. Just ahead they see a set of foot prints in the tar and study them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. The MAN looks through a pair of BINOCULARS and sees: A stooped figure up ahead, a DYING MAN dragging one leg slightly, limping along. He stops and stands uncertainly, then continues. The BOY sees him too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What should we do Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're all right. Let's just follow and watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Take a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah. Take a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DYING MAN is getting slower and slower as they climb a slope, following, until he finally stops and simply sits in the road. The BOY hangs onto the MAN's coat anxiously as they approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - the DYING MAN is burnt, his clothing scorched and skin black with soot. One eye is burnt shut and his hair is a nitty wig of ash. His shoes are bound with wire and coated with road tar. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they pass by the DYING MAN looks down, averting his eyes. The BOY keeps looking, unable to take his eyes off him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa, what's wrong with that man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's been struck by lightning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can't we help him? Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. We can't help him. They keep walking away and the BOY tugs at the MAN's coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can't we help him, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. We can't. There's nothing to be done for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 3) - EVENING They are camped under the bridge, ash and slurry drift by on the river, a dull sulphur light from the fires glows against the sky. The BOY sits in silence with his back to the MAN. MAN. There's nothing we could have done. (NO REPLY.) He's going to die. We can't share what we have or we'll die too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So when are you going to talk to me again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm talking now. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come to a barn beside the road. They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Let's take a look. The man picks up the revolver and they go inside cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three pairs of FEET wearing different shoes - a man's shoes, a woman's shoes, and a CHILD's sneakers - hang above three carefully placed chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't look. The BOY looks at the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You don't need to see this. The BOY takes a few steps, exploring, he eyes the empty hay loft but avoids looking at the hanged bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There could be something here. There could be corn or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No, they ran out of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe we could find some hayseeds in the hayloft? Now the BOY goes over to the swinging CORPSES, oddly curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's not what-you think. They committed suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What does that mean? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You know what that means. The MAN GOES outside while the BOY thinks about it a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk away from the eerily silent farm, stopping at an abandoned TRACTOR by a weathered, paint stripped letter box. MAN. Come here. The BOY goes over and the MAN takes out his revolver, opens the magazine and shows him: two bullets in the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You see that? Two left. One for you and one for me. He places the BOY's thumb on the hammer and cocks the pistol. He curls the BOY's index finger around the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You put it in your mouth and point it up. Like this. Just like I showed you. He puts the barrel of the pistol in his own mouth until the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, wide eyed. He takes the pistol out of his mouth and uncocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay. The MAN puts the gun away and cuddles the BOY close. They set off again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the WOMAN is sitting by the window, staring out at the garden which is barren now, the sky gray but tinged with the same fireglow seen earlier, a film of gray ash covers dead lawn and shrubs and inside the paintwork is grimy and colorless now, a lot of the furniture gone. A pile of broken up furniture and pieces of the piano are-stacked up next to the fireplace. In the fireplace the scorched, ashen remains of piano keys. The WOMAN is now heavily pregnant. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sets down chipped old plates and spoons, spoons beans from a pot and sits to eat. As the WOMAN starts to eat she winces and freezes with a look of horror, spoon halfway to her mouth. She looks down and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WOMAN - water and blood running down her legs. WOMAN. Oh no. Oh no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's okay, I'll help you. Just like we said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No no no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll heat water. We can do it. As he goes out she MOANS in despair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN rushes in and opens a drawer in the sideboard. Instead of cutlery it contains a pair of kitchen shears, a bottle of antiseptic, worn but clean towels and a pair of worn out yellow rubber dish gloves, all laid out in readiness. The WOMAN appears at the door, blood running down a leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We don't have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, I think we probably do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What kind of life is this? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's life. It's the only thing left. He takes the WOMAN back into the other room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The WOMAN lies on the dining room table SCREAMING as she has her first contractions. The MAN is wearing the rubber gloves, one gloved hand resting on the WOMAN's leg, about to deliver his own baby. He wipes his brow and leaves a smear of blood as the SCREAMING goes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRAILER HOME - (CAMP 4)- EVENING Inside a badly damaged trailer home, one wall half fallen off, a pan of water boils on a small fire. The BOY sits shivering in a blankets as he eats beans from a tin, scraping around for the last one or two. The MAN opens his knapsack by the fire and produces a packet of COCOA. He fixes a cup of cocoa for the boy. He hands the BOY the cup of cocoa and as the BOY examines it and drinks, the MAN surreptitiously pours himself a mug of water and sits blowing on it. The BOY realises the MAN has left him all the cocoa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You promised not to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You know what, Papa. I have to watch you all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If you break little promises you'll break big ones. That's what you said. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN relents, pouring the hot water back into the pan and taking some of the BOY's cocoa into his own cup. The BOY wipes his finger around the inside of the empty bean tin and licks his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Watch your finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You always say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's because you always do it. The MAN spreads bits of a worn out road map on the boards and studies them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We have to keep moving. We have to go south to the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It'll be better at the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Because we're going to freeze here. He picks up the map pieces carefully. EXT. TURNPIKE - MORNING The MAN and the BOY truck along the blacktop. At the crest of a hill they come to FADED BILLBOARDS advertising MOTELS and stop. The BOY notices a sign in the distance, which has words painted over a faded advertisement: odd, nonsensical, Biblical ramblings about "bones" and "the dead." The MAN follows the BOY's gaze and reads: "BEHOLD THE VALLEY OF SLAUGHTER - JEREMIAH 19:6." MAN. Do you remember your alphabet? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can you read that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (SCRUTINISING IT.) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Good, let's go. The MAN takes out a large REVOLVER, cocks it in readiness and places it on the tarp as they move. The BOY eyes the MAN nervously, eyes the gun and they move off. EXT. TURNPIKE, TUNNEL APPROACH - DAY They trudge along the turnpike towards the opening of a deep, black tunnel and the BOY suddenly comes to a stop, increasingly upset, unable to face the yawning mouth of the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't, I just can't... MAN. There's no other way. BOY. We could go over. MAN. We can't take the cart over. BOY. We don't know what's in there. MAN. There's nothing in there. It's just the same as it is out here. Okay? BOY. (BEAT. VERY RELUCTANT.) Okay. The boy sticks close to the MAN's side. The man has the revolver in his belt now and his parka unzipped, ready as they nervously walk towards the mouth of the tunnel. 14.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN has his arm around the boy as they push the cart cautiously ahead, acutely aware of all that's around them. They pass footprints in the dried sludge on the ground. Ash and litter blowing about and a handful of MUMMIFIED DEAD REFUGEES appear along the sides of the tunnel, sitting and lying on camp stretchers, their bags and supplies long since looted. They are shrivelled and drawn like latterday bogfolk, shoeless, a couple of men, a woman a small child and a DOG. The MAN stares at the group. The BOY stares at the small child and then at the mummified DOG, transfixed. The MAN puts out his hand for the BOY to take - the BOY takes his hand and the MAN moves him on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just remember that the things you put into your head are forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But you forget some things don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 5) - EARLY MORNING The MAN and the BOY are asleep inside an abandoned car amongst a line of other abandoned vehicles littering the turnpike. INT. ABANDONED CAR - (CAMP 5) - EARLY MORNING Now the BOY's hand rests on the MAN's chest as he sleeps. The MAN breathes stertorously, wheezing a little and the BOY'S small hand goes up and down on his chest. Suddenly the MAN wakes and rolls onto his side, listening, the revolver lying beside him. He slips his hand onto the revolver and raises his head slowly. He looks around - nothing but the sound of a distant DIESEL ENGINE. He looks at the BOY fast asleep. When he looks back at the tunnel he sees a nightmarish vision: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - Exiting the tunnel, shuffling through the ash, a group of HOODED MEN, some in gas masks and filthy biohazard suits, slouching along, coughing, casting their heads from side to side and swinging clubs and lengths of pipe - a ROAD GANG. The MAN listens to the sound of a DIESEL TRUCK behind the gang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Quickly. Quick... The BOY jolts awake as the MAN shoves his pistol in his belt, grabs the boy by the hand. They slide out of the car and crouch on the ground, the BOY is frozen with fear. MAN. (CONT'D) It's all right. It's all right but we have to run. Don't look back. Come on. Their backpacks are still left in the back of the car... MAN. (CONT'D) Run... run... The flat bed truck RUMBLES into view, MEN from the GANG standing on the flat bed looking around, some holding rifles. The BOY falls and the MAN pulls him to his feet with such force he lifts him clean off the ground and has to dangle him back down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You okay? It's all right... come on... They rush down the embankment into the trees alongside the turnpike. EXT. TURNPIKE UNDERPASS - DAY They run through the woods. The truck is heard in the background, the motor missing and SPUTTERING, coils of black diesel smoke coiling through the woods. The motor dies with a flapping RATTLE and there's SILENCE. The MAN and the BOY crouch in frozen silence, the Truck now on the overpass nearby, dangerously exposed to the view of the Gang. They listen to the GANG TALKING and raising the hood of the truck The MAN puts his arm around the BOY and draws his pistol as they see the truck begin to roll, the GANG pushing it... but it coughs and stalls again. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN sees one of the GANG MEMBERS coming down the embankment, unbuckling his belt. He is emaciated, in dirty blue overalls and a gas company cap, and has a long beard cut square at the bottom and a bad tattoo of a bird on his neck. He doesn't stop, just keeps coming, closer and closer until he's just feet away, almost on top of them. He unzips his pants and takes a piss. As he stands pissing his eyes roam around - at any moment he could look to the side and see them crouching there. The MAN is wide-eyed, gun ready, eyes darting from the GANG MEMBER to the BOY to the GUN. The GANG MEMBER rolls his shoulders and exercises his neck... he looks down and studies the steam coming off his piss. The MAN silently trains his pistol at the head of the GANG MEMBER who, as if by instinct, rolls his head around and looks right at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just keep it coming. The GANG MEMBER sees the gun and stops pissing, looks back at the truck, zips his fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Don't look at them. Look at me. If you call out you're dead. Where you from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Does it matter? Where you from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's the truck running on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Diesel fuel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where d'you get that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't know, huh? The GANG MEMBER just stares, not answering. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You got ammunition for those rifles? The GANG MEMBER looks back towards the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I told you not to look back there. Where d'you get all that stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Found it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you eating?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Whatever we can find.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Whatever you can find, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah... Now the GANG MEMBER looks at the BOY, causing the MAN To raise the revolver and cock it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: GANG MEMBER - he looks down the barrel at the magazine and sees empty space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You won't shoot that thing. You ain't got but two shells. Maybe just one. And they'll hear the shot. On the over pass the ROAD GANG are looking around, MURMURING as they notice one of their number missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe. But you won't. It'll be through your skull and inside your brain before you can hear it. The MAN steps closer and aims the gun at the MAN's forehead, hammer back, ready. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) To hear it you'll need a frontal lobe and things with names like colliculus and temporal gyrus and you won't have them anymore because they'll just be soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are you a doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm not anything anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We got a hurt man. It'd be worth your while. The MAN glances in the direction of the ROAD GANG, then back at the GANG MEMBER, who is still eyeing the BOY. The BOY is sitting with his hands on top of his head, peeking out through his arms, terrified as the tension escalates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If you look at him again I'll shoot you in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll bet that boy is hungry. Why don't you all just come onto the truck. Get something to eat. Ain't no need to be such a hard ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't have anything to eat. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I ain't going nowheres.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You think I won't kill you but you're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You know what I think? I think you're chickenshit. You never killed a man in your life. He drops his belt on the ground with a CLATTER, a canteen and army pouch hanging from it. The MAN eyes the army pouch, eyes the GANG on the road - and notices for the first time some of them are wearing the same army pouches. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One is banging his stick on the side of the truck to call their lost member. The MAN is distracted by this and when he looks up the GANG MEMBER has taken two silent steps and is standing between him and the BOY, holding a knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do you think you're going to do with that? Without a word the GANG MEMBER dives and grabs the BOY, rolls and lands on his feet holding the BOY against his chest with his knife at his throat. Simultaneously the MAN drops to his knees, trains the pistol and fires from six feet away, shooting the GANG MEMBER in the forehead. He falls back and lies with blood bubbling from the wound, eyes open, the BOY lying in his lap in shock, deafened, expressionless, covered with gore and mute as a stone. The GANG hear the loud SHOT and freeze, they start looking around them more urgently now. The MAN grabs the dazed BOY by the hand and yells but in his deafness the BOY hears only a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: soup of words:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (MUTED.) Move! Let's go! The MAN shoves the pistol in his belt, hoists the BOY onto his shoulders and sets off down the road at a run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They crash through the woods, the MAN straining to keep the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: aloft and find a path through the trees - the BOY clutching the MAN's head with both hands. There's a sickening THUD and the MAN falls, the BOY flying off with a cry. The MAN struggles to gather his wits, unsure whether he's been felled by another man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (MUTED.) Come on. Get up, get up quickly! The MAN swings the BOY onto his shoulders and runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and BOY stagger through trees and the man drops to his knees, letting the BOY down. They are back by the turnpike again. They listen and watch, utterly exhausted and out of breath, the MAN is wheezing, the BOY at his side, holding his hand, staring, in shock still. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shh. It's okay now. You're going to be OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - the BOY can still HEAR nothing, temporarily deaf. But he sees the MAN talking and looking around, through 360 degrees, trying to work out where it's safe to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Come on. He grabs the BOY's hand and they take off again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN pulls out blankets from his knapsack. The BOY sits staring, shocked as the MAN tries to wipe the blood and gore from his face but it's thick and congealed now. His hands tremble as he tries to pick it from the BOY's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's okay... it's okay now... Frightened by the BOY's muteness, he wraps him in a blanket, unzips his parka and holds him close under the parka. The MAN picks up his revolver, checks the chamber, only one bullet left. He eyes the flickering shadows in the distance and then eyes the BOY, making minute calculations of distance, calibrating the space between the ROAD GANG and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He holds the revolver up and cocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) (CONT'D) I try to look like any common traveling killer but my heart is hammering. When it comes to the boy I have only one question: Can you do it? When the time comes? There is no moon, but not far away, perhaps 30 yards, a firey TORCH makes its way through the woods. About 50 yards away from that another TORCH is being used to search... shadows flicker ominously. The sounds of TWIGS snapping underfoot and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: being broken as the ROAD GANG searches wordlessly, just BREATHING heavily through their masks and beards. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: clutches the BOY tighter, and stifles a cough. They remain frozen like this, unable to budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are by a thin, toxic, rust-red stream, slushy ice at the edges and gray froth. The MAN leans down and pushes ice away and scoops up a hand full of gray water. He runs it through the boy's hair to wash it and the BOY flinches with cold. He rubs more icy water into the BOY's hair, roughly, quickly, with a sense of panic as he helplessly tries to-wash out lumps of flesh and blood. The BOY is weeping silently and shivering from the extreme cold as the MAN picks out the dried gore and washes the hair clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's no use crying. You have to talk to me. He takes the blanket and dries the BOY's hair as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I'm not going to let anything happen to you... I'm going to take care of you... I'm always going to try and be here for you... and I'm going to kill anybody who touches you. He smooths the BOY's hair down with shaking fingers, clumsily trying to brush it out of his eyes, a fatherly instinct to make the BOY neat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Because that's my job. Do you understand? When he's through the MAN lifts the BOY's thin arms, puts a vest over his head, then a ragged sweater, then he folds the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into his parka, zips it up to the neck and kisses him on the top of the head. The MAN grabs his knapsack, tips it upside down, rummages inside - it's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Come on, we need to get the cart back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Approaching the embankment, the MAN walks quickly and stealthily, wired, listening to the silence, straining to hear, sure he's being watched. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY stumbles along behind, slower, fatigued, makingthe
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: anxious. The MAN leaves the boy hiding:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) Wait here. He starts to climb the embankment and hears: little running FOOTSTEPS as the BOY comes after him, he turns to face the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: urgently, exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) (CONT'D) No I need you to wait. I'll hear you if you call. I'll just be a little ways and I'll be able to hear you if you get scared and you call me and I'll come right away. He walks off but hears... the little BOY's FOOTSTEPS running after him again - he turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I said wait! The BOY's face crinkles up and a tear rolls down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Stop it. I need you to do what I say. Take the gun. The BOY freezes, refusing to take the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Just take it will you? The BOY shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) We don't have time for this. We need our food. What's left. The MAN shoves the gun into the BOY's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Don't argue. He creeps up the embankment. The BOY just stares at the revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN searches for the cart. He comes to where they'd left it in between the abandoned cars. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their backpacks lie open on the ground, next to the cart on it's side, it's contents spilled out, mostly plundered, just a few children's BOOKS and TOYS, old pots and pans, shoes and ragged clothing remaining. Nearby are the remains of a large campfire in the middle of the turnpike. The man collects up the few remaining possessions and puts them into the backpacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - he sees charred billets of wood, ash and... the bones of the shot ROAD GANG MEMBER. Nearby is a pool of his blood and guts, still gently STEAMING, the head decapitated and rolled under a car. He nudges the bones with the toe of his shoe. EXT. EMBANKMENT BY THE TURNPIKE - DAY Below, down the embankment the BOY is waiting obediently with the gun. The MAN heads back to the BOY, trying to think what to say. The BOY hands the gun back and takes the MAN's hand and they walk away into the woods, the MAN tucking the gun back into his belt. MAN. Let's get out of here. The freeway's too dangerous. Find the back roads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay. INT. CLAPBOARD HOUSE - NIGHT FLASHBACK - Now the house is in considerable disrepair, no furniture, the skirting boards falling away, large cracks in the walls, cornices and lamp fittings pulling away from the ceilings, water marks from rain, the windows covered with corrugated iron sheets. The MAN and the WOMAN are sitting across from each other with a lamp illuminating the dark. Between them lies the revolver seen earlier. The WOMAN picks up the gun and swings open the magazine. There are two bullets in it, she takes them out and places them on the table, one after the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's all that's left. I should have done it when there were more bullets in the gun. The MAN shuts his eyes, unable to take it. In the corner, the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing in the background, drawing on the walls. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Sooner or later - no listen - they will catch up with us and they will kill us. They will rape me -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And they will rape him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please no - just - no
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They are going to rape us and kill us and eat us and you won't face it. You'd rather wait for it to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll do anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Such as what? She picks up the revolver and puts the TWO BULLETS into the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I thought about not even telling you. Just doing it. I'd empty every godamn bullet into my brain and leave you with nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't say that. Don't talk this way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nothing left to talk about... my heart was ripped out of me the night he was born... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please don't do this. I won't let anything happen. We'll survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to survive! I'd take him with me if it weren't for you. You know I would. Why can't you face it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will you listen? You're talking
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's not crazy and you know it. It's the right thing to do. They glance at the BOY. WOMAN. (CONT'D) Other families do it. She goes to the BOY, strokes his hair, kisses him, makes a reassuring display of being motherly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Time for bed, there's a good boy. She picks him up in her arms and carries him off to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The THUNDER of a waterfall, the river disappears into space - the BOY and the MAN stand staring up at the waterfall, 80 feet above, shrouded in gray mist. A color spectrum is visible rising from the waterfall, like a rainbow - the boy is transfixed, clutching the MAN's arm for safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it? The MAN looks at the BOY, surprised he's talking again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's a waterfall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Look. Colors. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There used to be color everywhere. You don't remember. It was before you were born. There used to be so many thnings... The BOY approaches the water's edge, shallow and clear with gravel and pebbles sparkling at the bottom. He scoops up some water, surprised that it seems clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Look. It's clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you want to go in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sure you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just don't swallow any. The MAN unzips his parka and slips it to the ground. The BOY eyes the MAN, surprised - then does the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naked, pale, filthy dirty and shivering with cold, the BOY frolics in the spray of the waterfall. The MAN watches him enjoying himself by the waterfall, clutching his shoulders, hopping up and down, he joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 6) - EVENING The MAN has strung the tarp against a rockface to make a shelter. He meticulously filters water through a rag into a pan. In the background, the waterfall can be heard RUMBLING. The BOY has painted his face with CRAYONS, drawing a bizarre set of FANGS and dripping blood around his mouth. The MAN studies the BOY's painted face a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Listen. That man back there... there's not many good guys left, that's all. We have to watch out for the bad guys. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) And we have to talk. Always. We have to just... you know... keep carrying the fire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What fire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The fire inside you. The BOY is thoughtful a minute, and then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are we still the good guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. We're still the good guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And we always will be no matter what happens? He eyes the BOY uncertainly, unsure if he can promise this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Always will be. Yeah. The MAN goes back to tying the tarp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and the BOY are trudging along, away from the waterfall now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We have to keep moving. Other people might be attracted to the waterfall just like we were. We wouldn't hear them coming. They stop to look at a lake surrounded by fog down in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you think there could be fish in the lake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. There's nothing in the lake. They move on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come around a bend in the road and immediately hear the ROAR of river rapids. Up ahead they see a bridge with a jack- knifed TRUCK on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk out onto the bridge over GREY FROTHING WATER, and inspect the truck. The tyres are flat, the cab jammed against the railings. The trailer end has swung across the road, knocked out the railings and lies with it's last few feet hanging over the side of the bridge, blocking the bridge off completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN climbs up onto the gas tanks, wipes the glass and peers into the cab. He swings the door open and climbs inside, pulling the door shut behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks around at discarded detritus, old magazines and trash. He checks behind the seats where there is a mattress on a bunk and calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 7) - NIGHT SNOW continues to fall on the dusty WINDSCREEN. Outside, all around snow falls, silently, covering the truck and the bridge, transforming it. They are both still awake, unable to sleep, staring at the transformed world, carpeted by snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know. So am I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can I ask you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are we going to die? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. Sometime. Not now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And we're still going south?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So we'll be warm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And there might be food there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everything depends on reaching the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay. The MAN draws a blanket around him and kisses him goodnight, it is now pitch black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I wish I was with my mom. They are silent a moment, until:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You mean you wish you were dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You mustn't say that. It's a bad thing to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't help it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know but you have to. You have to stop thinking about her. We both do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How do I do that? The MAN is silent, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 7) EARLY HOURS The man gets down from the cab and walks a few feet in the dark and snow. He coughs a bit, takes a few breaths of air, and walks away from the truck, vanishing into the mist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 7) - EARLY HOURS The MAN is alone now by the road. He takes out his WALLET and sifts through: money, ancient cards, driver's license and a picture of HIMSELF and the WOMAN on their WEDDING DAY, which he studies a moment sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) She was gone, and the coldness of it was her final gift... she died somewhere in the dark... there is no other tale to tell. He lays everything out on the grey slushy ground, then flings the wallet into the river and walks back to camp, leaving the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and cards to blow away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WOMAN kisses the MAN. MAN. Will you tell him goodbye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. I won't. I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will you at least wait till morning? Stay with me through the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. I have to go now. They kiss again, she turns and walks away out of the yard. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What am I going to tell him? What are we going to do without you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You should move south. You won't survive another winter here. The MAN follows a few steps and she stops and turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why won't you help me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't help you. Don't you understand? This is how I'm helping you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where are you going to go? You can't even see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't need to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm begging you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please don't. Please. The MAN stares. She goes, vanishing into the darkness. END OF FLASHBACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN stares. In the distance, a dead city. EXT. OVERPASS/CITY LIMITS - EVENING The MAN and the BOY approach the edge of the city. Up ahead a cluster of three tall buildings, a dozen or so floors of concrete and glass, the upper floors of one illuminated by the flickering fire glow of candle light inside. The MAN stops and stares and the BOY follows his gaze. In one of the illuminated windows a SILHOUETTE FIGURE stares back at them, somebody in the building. In another window another SILHOUETTE FIGURE is staring out, motionless, they could be refugees, cannibals or more mummified dead for all we know. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who are they, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What if it's more bad guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It won't be more bad guys. Don't worry. Stay close. He takes hold of the gun and they walk in a different direction now, giving the high rises a wide berth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Keep low. We'll be okay. When they get to the end of the block they stop and the MAN checks around the corner before they cross the street. In the distance three men appear, emaciated, slow-moving. They step forward, stop and watch the BOY and the MAN. EXT. OUTSKIRTS/CITY - DAY The MAN, now carrying the revolver, and the BOY head off down a railway track that leads away from the city. EXT. COUNTRY RAILWAY LINE - DAY In the country, along the railway, they see past a small road to a once grand house on a rise. It is tall and stately with white Doric columns across the front and a gravel drive that curves up from the road through a field of dead, foot long grass. They stand there staring at it, the BOY still holding the MAN's hand. The MAN listens - nothing but the WIND in the dead bracken, a CREAK of a door or shutter rattling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think we should take a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nothing to be scared of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVEWAY/STATELY HOME The MAN sets off up the drive. He stops and faces the BOY who is rooted to the spot. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You want to stay here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. The BOY joins him and they set off slowly up the drive, through patches of melting snow. There is a tall dead privet fence with a deserted birdsnest in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PORCH/STATELY HOME - DAY They climb the steps to the porch, the BOY clutching the MAN's hand. They notice a window is slightly open. The MAN goes to it, opens the window wide, looks inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOYER/STATELY HOME - DAY They climb through the window onto black and white marble tiles and the MAN carefully shuts the window a little so it's the same as when he found it. They regard the room, binoculars set up on a tripod sit next to an arm chair. An elaborate staircase in front of them, William Morris wall paper, water stained and sagging, plaster moldings and cornices sagging from the ceiling. They cross back to the other side where there is a great hall of a drawing room, high ceilings, huge fire place with raw brick around it where the wood has been stripped, a pile of warm-weather clothing, boots and backpacks on the floor by the hearth. BOY. Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/STATELY HOME - DAY They creep in and find blackened pots and pans, a cord with a bell for servants, trash piled on the floor and work tops, a rusted sink covered in mould, bare cupboards. In the floor is a hatch with a lock set in a steel plate. The man examines it while the BOY tugs at his arm, frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa, let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's a reason this is locked. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is now panicky, hopping about, close to tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't open it - don't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I need something to pry it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No! The MAN goes out abruptly and the BOY follows, wringing his hands in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK GARDEN/STATELY HOME - DAY The MAN comes out the back door with his revolver drawn, looks around and sees an old station wagon with flat tyres on the dead grass. Beside it is a 40 gallon cauldron on the blackened remnants of a fire. There is also a wooden SMOKE HOUSE with thin wisps of smoke coming off it. The MAN studies it nervously, sniffing the air, then goes to the tool shed and starts sorting through tools. He finds a long handled spade and hefts it in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/STATELY HOME - DAY The spade chops into the wood around the lock on the hatch. The MAN hacks away, then prizes up the hatch, lock and all, revealing a gap of darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Listen to me. Just stop it. We're starving. Do you understand? I have to do this. I don't have any choice. The MAN opens the hatch fully and lies it on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Just wait here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm going with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay. Just stay close to me. Nothing's going to happen. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They descend the rough wooden steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CELLAR/STATELY HOME - DAY There is a terrible stench and they have to cover their mouths and noses with their parkas. The MAN gets out his lighter, lights it and tries to light the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - BLACKNESS except the small area illuminated by the lighter as the MAN searches: part of a stone wall; then a clay floor; an old mattress with dark stains. The glow of the flame crawls across the floor to a corner as the MAN steps closer, then plays the lighter along from the corner to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huddled against the wall, all trying to hide, shielding their shining eyes from the light, NAKED MEN and WOMEN, thin as skeletons like inmates in a death camp. The BOY jumps, shocked and the MAN freezes, staring, dumb struck by: On a mattress on the floor lies a NAKED MAN with his legs gone to the hip, their stumps blackened and burned, cauterized. The BOY covers his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jesus... The MAN on the MATTRESS turns to them and WHISPERS, a low indistinct murmur at first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Help us... please help us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Christ... oh Christ... The others join in, an eerie chorus of WHISPERING, "Help us... please help us..." The MAN turns and grabs the BOY and rushes for the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Hurry... go... move! The MAN drops the lighter as he tries to push the BOY up the steps. Out of nowhere a BEARDED FACE appears at the foot of the stairs, blinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please... they're taking us to the smoke house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BEARDED FACE reaches out and feebly tries to grab the MAN's arm but he breaks free and concentrates on getting the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: up the steps, following in a blind panic, fumbling and missing his footing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hurry - hurry! They scramble up the steps towards the light of the hatch as the BEARDED FACE reaches out and tries one last time to grab at the MAN's feet but he kicks free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/STATELY HOME - DAY The MAN scrambles out, slams the door shut and drags a solid table over the door. He looks around for the BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Christ. Run! The BOY is near the window, dancing up and down in terror, pointing out the window to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming up the path toward the house are four BEARDED MEN and two WOMEN, all suspiciously well fed and healthy-looking. One of the MEN holds hands with one of the WOMEN, as if they were returning from a stroll before dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/STATELY HOME - DAY The MAN stares a moment, frozen with horror, then grabs the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: by the hand and jerks him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Run. Run!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOYER/STATELY HOME - DAY They tear through to the front door, the MAN fumbles to get it open but it has a well-maintained deadlock on it. He stares out the window next to the door and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - The WELL-FED PEOPLE are climbing the steps of the porch. The MAN Grabs the BOY and they rush through into kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/STATELY HOME - DAY In the kitchen the hatch is being lifted from underneath and the table elevating inches. They rush back out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOYER/STATELY HOME - DAY As they reach the stairs, a key turns in the lock and the MAN picks up the BOY in his arms and they sprint to a door under the stairs. As they get through the door the front door swings open and the WELL-FED PEOPLE drift inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are in a small rest room under the stairs, just a toilet and a basin. The BOY's face is level with the basin and while the MAN is holding the door shut the BOY comes face to face with the contents of the basin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - bloodstained clothing soaking in bloody water and tallow in the basin. Around the basin are bloody red hand prints on the white porcelain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - through a thin crack he sees the WELL-FED PEOPLE on the far side of the foyer, chatting casually. He is not close enough to hear everything they say, but close enough to see that the MEN's beards are trimmed and they wear well-repaired clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm going to freshen up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I need a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm going up to change. He hears one of the WOMEN STOMPING across the old floorboards and up the stairs to change while the other WOMAN takes a few steps towards the rest room, then turns back towards the window as the conversation lurches on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who left this window open?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I leave it open for the smell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't smell it anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who wants a drink? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear the sound of the WINDOW BEING CLOSED and LATCHED. As all this goes on, the MAN is frozen, eyes wide with fear, he slips the pistol from his belt, cocks it and squats on his haunches so he's close to the BOY, desperate, unable to decide what to do, unable to think straight with fear. The BOY is staring from the door to the pistol to the bloodied basin as if hypnotised, in shock, babbling somewhat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (MUMBLING, TO SELF.) Bad guys... bad men...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shh, shh... There are FOOT STEPS outside the door as the WELL FED PEOPLE drift closer and then away again. The man starts to cough but he has the revolver in one hand and the BOY's hand in his other. The MAN tries to stifle his cough but can't. Then the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: notices and holds his own small hand to the MAN's mouth, stifling his coughing as the talk goes on outside:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will you help me with the dirty dishes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm hungry. As the coughing subsides a little the MAN takes the BOY's hand from his mouth and pushes the revolver into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Take it. The BOY tries to resist, shaking his head, terrified, mute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (WHISPERS.) (CONT'D) Take it. The MAN puts his left arm around the BOY's tiny, thin shoulders and holds him close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (WHISPERS.) (CONT'D) Don't be afraid. If they get hold of you, you're going to have to do it just like everybody else. Do you understand? Shh. No crying. Do you hear me? The WOMAN turns from the window and one of the BEARDED MEN pours whiskey and hands her one. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is weeping and shaking his head as the MAN shows him again what to do with the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) Stop crying. You have to be a brave boy. You know how to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) I think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) Say "Yes I do Papa." He stares down at the little BOY who just holds the gun feebly... he realises the BOY won't use it. After a moment of torturous contemplation, the MAN very gently takes the gun from the BOY's hand and the BOY sits forlornly, staring down at his hands, afraid to look at the MAN now. When the BOY looks up again he is staring down the barrel of the pistol, the MAN aiming the large revolver at the BOY's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you doing? The MAN's hand shakes, his thumb trembles on the hammer as he cocks it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will I see you again? When will I see you? The MAN's finger trembles on the trigger as he slowly squeezes it... At that moment there's a loud THUMP from the kitchen and the WELL FED PEOPLE stop and listen, then rush through to the kitchen, and immediately there's a commotion as they see the state of the hatch with the table over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.O.V.) What the fuck do you think you're doing? Huh? What the fuck do you think you're doing...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.O.V.) Don't look at me like that. What are you doing? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN gathers his wits and opens the door a crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Follow me, take my hand, don't let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOYER/STATELY HOME - DAY The MAN bursts out of the rest room with the BOY and they make a dash for the open window. He sticks his gun in his belt and wrestles with the window, an old colonial style frame which sticks. From behind the closed kitchen door they hear muffled GRUNTS and SHOUTS until the MAN wrenches the window open, stuffs the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PORCH/STATELY HOME - DAY The MAN picks the BOY up and they rush down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVEWAY/STATELY HOME - DAY They rush down the driveway and the MAN drags the BOY through a gap in the dead privet hedge onto the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hesitate a moment on the road, deciding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on, keep running! They rush across the road to the woods on the other side, the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ahead as the MAN checks behind them. The MAN looks back towards the house and two of the WELL-FED PEOPLE have come outside, looking around suspiciously. He hits the ground and takes the BOY with him, they lie flat at the edge of the woods and the road. They are wildly out of breath, chests heaving, the MAN coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Keep your head down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - the WELL-FED PEOPLE walk a few steps down the drive and a BEARDED MAN looks through BINOCULARS at the road and the woods, but not directly at the MAN and the BOY hiding. The WELL FED PEOPLE start looking around the side of the house, walking away. The MAN and the BOY get up, dash through the treeline and disappear into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A dull moon hidden in the ashen sky and the outlines of trees as they set off through the woods, sleepy, stumbling like drunks now. They hear a hideous SHRIEK in the distance, coming from the house. They stop, hearing another SHRIEK and a MAN'S SCREAMING. The MAN holds the BOY close and tries to cover the BOY's ears as they stare and wait for-it to pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We'll be safe soon. BOY. They're going to eat those people aren't they, Papa? The MAN does not answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are back in the city, trudging through the parking lot of a huge shopping mall, just outside what used to be SEARS department store. A dull moon hidden in the ashen sky illuminates the ruined store front as the MAN looks up at the mall, thinking. The BOY is just staring into space, still in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 8) - NIGHT The MAN and the BOY have set up camp in the mall, outside the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: entrance. The MAN is building a big fire. The BOY stares through the glass at the deserted department store. Nearby, strewn across the doorway are bunches and bundles of cash in notes and coins... the BOY looks closer and finds expensive items of jewelry still in their boxes, LOOTED from the store and discarded. The BOY sits, he looks like he's given up, and then: BOY. Papa? Papa, we wouldn't ever eat anybody would we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. Of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No matter how hungry we were. Even if we were starving? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're starving now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Because, because we're the good guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And we're carrying the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. The MAN takes the BOY in his arms. In a moment the BOY starts blinking sleepily and drifts off to sleep and the MAN strokes the sleeping BOY's hair and kisses him on the forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk through the parking lot until the come to a supermarket around the other side. A few old cars in a trash strewn parking lot. The MAN heads through the defunct automatic doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on. There's nobody here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and the BOY trudge the empty aisles, only litter remaining, the once brightly-colored packaging strewn around, it's contents long since looted. In the empty gun section there is a deer's head mounted on the wall. The BOY stops and stares, mesmerised while the MAN searches the empty shelves for ammo, finding only empty boxes. The MAN glimpses a woman's face staring dolefully from an aisle - an emaciated, dead beat SCAVENGER watching them, vanishing as quickly as she appeared. On their way out they come to a pair of vending machines tipped over, the sodas looted, coins scattered around in the ash. The MAN sits beside one and feels inside the gutted machine, eventually producing a single unopened can of COCA COLA. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (EXCITED.) What is it, papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's a treat for you. Here. Sit down. He helps the little BOY off with his knapsack and sits him down and opens the can of COKE ceremoniously. The BOY looks startled and sniffs the fizzing can as if it's the strangest thing he's ever seen in his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Go ahead. The BOY takes the can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's bubbly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go ahead. Drink it. The BOY takes a sip and considers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's really good. You have some, papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. I want you to drink it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But I want you to have some. The MAN reluctantly takes the can and has a tiny sip, hands it back to the wary BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) It's because I'll never get to drink another one, isn't it? The MAN doesn't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They head out of the mall now towards the road, lifeless traffic lights at the intersection, town houses and apartment blocks on the other side of the road. The BOY stops to listen, stares around, suddenly energised, bobbing on his toes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I didn't hear anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't hear anything. They listen more until, very faintly we hear a DOG BARK in the distance. The BOY turns around 180 degrees to listen, alert with anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) It's a dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (EXCITED.) A dog! Where did it come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. Come on. The MAN walks across the road, past the apartments and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follows, bouncing up and down, over-excited now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're not going to kill it are we Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What? No, we're not going to kill it. Why did you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You still got one bullet left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're not going to hurt the dog, I promise. We're not going to kill it and we're not going to eat it either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (OVER EXCITED, NOT FRIGHTENED.) Maybe it'll eat us! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I doubt it very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can we look for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's gone, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They trudge through the suburbs on the edge of the city, past what used to be the local ball park, now barren, dead, a vast flat expanse of ash and cracked, scorched earth, forlorn stands and bleachers blackened by ash and soot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I used to watch the ball games here with my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk up a once tree-lined suburban street, barren now, ash and dust layer what used to be front lawns, post boxes, picket fences, porches, crazy paving. The MAN stops outside a typical, suburban clapboard house with a dead, cracked yard where the lawn used to be and a bare flag pole. The BOY eyes the MAN enquiringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is this place, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's the house where I grew up. They go up to the house - clapboards have been removed for firewood leaving studs and insulation exposed. The BOY stops, reluctant to go further, and the MAN takes a few more steps then turns around to check on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't you want to see where I grew up? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There might be somebody in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nobody there now. The MAN takes the BOY's hand and they approach a basketball hoop by the garage. The MAN is momentarily overcome with emotion as he recalls the details, but it doesn't mean much to the BOY. After a moment the MAN goes up the steps - frightened, but horribly compelled at the same time. The BOY follows nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We've got to find something to eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm not hungry. I'm not! The MAN takes his revolver from his belt and approaches the front door, warily pushing it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We'll be all right. Come on. He goes through the front door - the BOY stays where he is, rigid with fear. The BOY notices a stuffed toy dog in the window, staring out at the garden and his curiosity takes over. The BOY goes inside carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pine panelling is stripped from the walls, there is some broken furniture but much has been taken for firewood. They go over to the fireplace and the MAN examines it. He runs his fingers along the mantle where there is an old drawing pin still stuck in the wood, nostalgia overcoming his fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . This is where we used to have Christmas when I was a boy. We'd hang our stockings right here. The MAN examines the yellow tiled surround. The BOY watches the MAN as if he's gone mad. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) My mother scrubbed these every day. It's still spotless. Much of the woodwork and the floorboards have been stripped and taken for firewood - there are gaping holes. By the fireplace is a small pile of bones - and--in the grid are more burnt bones and the skull from the family cat. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes it all in sadly but the BOY is unmoved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa? I don't think we should do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You want to wait outside? The BOY nods vigorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) All right. He takes the BOY's hand and leads him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The come out onto the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sit here on the stoop and don't go away. The BOY sits quietly and the MAN goes back inside. After a moment he starts going through his knapsack, less afraid now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floorboards CREAK horribly, swollen from rain or ripped up, as he creeps into the living room. The timber cladding is stripped from the walls, the ceiling plaster is collapsed, beams exposed. The MAN pads through to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kitchen is similarly dilapidated, the cupboards stripped bare. On a shelf by the window are dusty jars of fruit, preserved. He grabs a jar, prizes open the lid and finds a an oily slick of black mucus floating in the top, like rotted mushroom spores. He sniffs it suspiciously, holds it up to the light. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the light small black fish hook-shaped spores drift from the top of the jar to the bottom. He replaces the lid, appalled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is sitting on the steps of the porch drawing with crayons on a pad taken from his knapsack. Across the road is another big old house, much of the clapboard missing, swathed in dead brambles - the BOY suddenly looks up and stares at it, distracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN comes outside and regards the deadened yard, old garden hoe and spade, gardening equipment and several dead apple trees. He goes over and examines the ashen ground and digs about to unearth several small, dark brown, shrivelled spheres spaced several feet apart - apples. He bends down and picks one up, examines, sniffs. He gathers up the strange apples and stuffs them in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is still staring at the house across the road when he notices A GHOSTLY FACE, completely still, in a window. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops the pad and crayon and stands, surprised, not believing his eyes - it is the face of a SMALL BOY roughly his age, which disappears almost immediately, receding back into the gloom like a ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PANTRY/CLAPBOARD HOUSE - DAY The MAN is in the looted pantry. He finds some shrivelled raisins that haves spilt and hidden in the back of the shelf. He puts them into a handkerchief, folds it and pockets it. He HEARS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (O.O.V.) Stop - stop! The MAN freezes, then charges out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN rushes out and stares about frantically for the BOY - he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY has run across the road to another house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - peeping around the side of the house is the other
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the same age, similarly grimy and thin, wearing an outsize woollen coat. The other SMALL BOY disappears down the side and the BOY runs after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wait! Come back! I won't hurt you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY runs to the bottom of the yard where there is various suburban garden detritus, a dusty lawn mower, a clothes line, a shed, bikes with no tyres.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where are you?! The MAN comes sprinting up the side of the house and seizes him by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you doing? What the hell are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's a little boy, Papa, I saw a little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's no little boy. What's the matter with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes there is! I saw him! A boy just like me. The MAN takes the BOY by the arm and drags him back through the yard, up the side of the house, the BOY resisting, crying and looking back all the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Why? Why can't I go and see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out the front of the house the BOY digs his heels in and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has to drag him, his feet slithering through the dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I need to see him! I need to! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I just do! The BOY has gone limp, weeping bitterly, resisting being moved. The MAN gives up and squats beside the sobbing BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay, I'm sorry. I understand. He holds him, wipes his tears from his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the failing light they come across a late model Chevy abandoned under an overpass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa? Will there be other boys like me at the coast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I hope so. The MAN goes to the car, wipes thick dust from the windscreen and peers in - it's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 9) - NIGHT They try to get comfortable in the leather seats, the MAN spreading the blankets over them and tucking the BOY in. They are quiet a moment as they watch darkness start to fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I got you something The MAN produces from his pocket one of the tiny hard brown apples and holds it up to the remaining light.
