direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's an apple. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands it to the boy who examines it curiously. The MAN takes out a pocket knife, takes the apple back, cuts the apple in half to reveal a woody brown interior. They regard the mahogany apple uncertainly, the MAN is the first to take a bite, with some difficulty. The BOY bites his half and makes a face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Suck it a while and it'll soften. They sit sucking and chewing the ancient apple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Did you ever have any friends? The MAN eyes the BOY - curious at the sudden question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lots of them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you remember them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. I remember all of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What happened to them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All of them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. All of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and the BOY make their way out of the ruined city. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) He yearns for his own friends and imagines how things will be different at the coast - and that there will be other children there... .When I have nothing else, I try to dream the dreams of a child's imaginings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and BOY walk along a desolate road in what was once farmland, grain silos loom ominously, still standing. BOY. Do you know where we are Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think we're about two hundred miles from the coast. As the crow flies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "As the crow flies?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It means, going in a straight line. POV MAN - In the background, something catches his eye and he FOCUSES ON: A frieze of HUMAN HEADS, dried with taut grins and shrunken eyes, perched on wooden poles. Some are tattooed with targets and runic slogans. Some are skinless, with signs and words inked onto them. One has suture marks etched on it, like a blue print for assembly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There aren't any crows are there? Just in books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah, just in books... The MAN stares at the heads as the BOY continues his conversation, distracted and not seeing the heads. BOY. Do you think there might be crows somewhere? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But what do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think it's unlikely... They keep walking and talking, the MAN grim-faced but the BOY intent on what's ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Could they fly to Mars or some place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No, they couldn't fly to Mars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Because it's too far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. The MAN discretely hurries the BOY on with a guiding hand towards the woods and off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What if they tried and-and-and they just got halfway or something and then they were too tired? Would they fall back down...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the edge of the wood the MAN and the BOY stop to examine footprints in the snow. The MAN listens and hears: the low THUDDING of BULL DRUMS in the distance. He looks at the exhausted BOY a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We can't go back on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think someone's coming. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY stares at the tracks. The MAN stares in both directions, examining the road in the distance. He moves a few paces and notices tied to a dead sapling a thin red neckerchief. He takes a few steps and through a gap in the trees sees a clearing - snow and a mass of BLOOD RED FOOTPRINTS, the icy snow stained blood red like a sorbet. A killing floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will they see our tracks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We'll cover them. The MAN moves the BOY away and kicks snow over their tracks - then lays fresh ones going in several different directions. The BOY copies him, leaving his own maze of tracks. They run off keeping parallel with the road but staying off it. POV MAN - in the distance TWO FIGURES appear on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Here they come. The MAN now looks over his shoulder for a good look, then grabs the BOY's hand and takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come prowling on the ROAD, they are MILITANTS from some sort of ARMY, wearing the same red neckerchiefs and carrying weapons, searching, predatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - we see that only 30 feet away, concealed amongst the trees, the MAN and BOY are crouched in blankets, watching. The two MILITANTS stop and look around, as if they sense the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the MAN - who freeze, frightened to breathe. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sniff the air menacingly. One of them walks over to a stone by the side of the road, leans down and starts sharpening his lance, made from a the straightened coil spring of a car. The MAN and the BOY watch - wide-eyed. Eventually the MILITANTS walk off up the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are we going to do? No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 10) - EVENING There is a thick carpet of gray snow. The man lays out a tarp on the ground and blankets on top. Out of the murky sky more gray snow is falling. The MAN is distracted by a sudden noise, the LOUD CRACK of sheering wood - this time very close. He looks around just as: Out of nowhere a tree branch sails down, barely missing them, landing with a heavy WHUMP just feet away. MAN. Move! Quickly! He tries to get the BOY to his feet but he is limp, staring around blearily, exhausted. They hear another loud WHUMP. Then the GROAN of timber and another WHUMP as trees start to keel over around them. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs the BOY and runs as best he can through the snow and falling trees. They have abandoned their blankets, tarp and backpacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's happening? MAN. Just keep moving, run! They rush through the woods as more and more trees fall one after the other, WHUMP, WHUMP, WHUMP, great loads of snow falling from limbs to the ground with a BOOM, setting the woods shuddering. The BOY is getting bogged in the snow and the MAN stoops and scoops up the BOY and they cram themselves under a fat fallen tree to shield themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 11) - NIGHT They are huddled inside a huge SEWER PIPE, sheltering. The BOY is wrapped up inside the man's coat, wet and shivering, wide awake, nerves shredded, too anxious to lie down and sleep now. The MAN boils water in a car hubcab. He takes from his pocket the handkerchief filled with raisins, offers them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's all there is, isn't it? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nothing left anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. They sit eating raisins, saying nothing until they're finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can I ask you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are we going to die now? The MAN just looks at the BOY, then looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do you think is going to happen? We're just going to suddenly keel over and die? It takes a long time to die of starvation. The important thing is water to stop you dehydrating. We've got water. We'll be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snowed in farmland, in the background a rowoffallen and crumpled high tension electrical towers. Atownin the far distance ahead of the BOY and the MAN. TheBOYis hunched over with a hunger cramp. They are both wetandshivering. The MAN eyes the BOY anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN stands on the back patio of a house on the edge of town, the BOY at his side, fields stretching out before them, the land flattened and dead, ravaged fences running the perimeter. In the yard are a few dead trees, a fence, a metal tool shed, an old barbecue on the patio made from a 44 gallon drum. The MAN slides the patio door open and peers inside gingerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN is in the bedroom looking around for useful things - it has been stripped, the wooden frame gone from the window, the bureau ransacked and chopped up - only a summer dress on a wire hanger on the back of the door remains. He glances at empty drawers on the floor and a cupboard before turning his attention to the bed. He blinks and sways a moment, trying to focus on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - underneath the filthy, dusty blankets a thin, dried head pokes out, the blankets pulled up to the chin. On the pillow are long hunks of rotted hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (V.0.) Every day is a lie. But I am slowly dying. That is not a lie .I am trying to prepare him for the day when I am gone. He takes hold of the lower hem of the blanket and tows it off the bed, revealing a desiccated corpse. He ignores it, shaking the blanket out and folding it under his arm. He notices the BOY at his side, watching wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Nothing you haven't seen before. They go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN opens and shuts empty cupboards, slamming the doors, increasingly desperate, close to tears of frustration now. Eventually he feels dizzy and has to sit on the floor. He just sits there, alone on the kitchen floor, clenching and unclenching his fists, his head in his hands, when he hears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (O.O.V.) Papa! The MAN draws his pistol and goes out, alert again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is staring at himself in a dusty, flyblown full length mirror. As the MAN comes in he sees the BOY's reflection and his own and jumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's us. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY stares at his reflection - he looks like an alien, skinny with giant staring eyes on shaky legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) We look skinny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We are skinny. The MAN puts the blanket around the BOY's shoulders. He notices an old upright piano, covered in ash and dust. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares as he goes to it, lifts the lid and plays a chord. The BOY's eyes light up and he is magnetized, instantly coming over and waiting for the next note. The MAN plays another chord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's a piano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . For making music. This... (HE
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .) is music. Your mother played very well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't remember. MAN. Before you were born. We had one just like it. It was beautiful. BOY. What happened to it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Chopped it up for firewood. He stares into space, slumps suddenly, overcome with emotion as he remembers: INT. CLAPBOARD HOUSE - DAY FLASHBACK - Just the MAN and the pregnant WOMAN alone in the house, just before the BOY was born. Some of the furniture has been broken up for firewood - there are broken pieces by the fire and a huge axe propped on the hearth. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WOMAN stands at the piano and tries to play. She plays for a moment and the MAN cracks a rare smile - the piano is out of tune and she stops. She plays a bit more but soon starts to bang the keys atonally in frustration. The MAN just lets her get on with it until she's spent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I used to worry what would happen if there was a fire. What would I save? What could I bear to lose? There used to be so many things, so many beautiful things. Things people made. Things nature made. Who knew we would lose it all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll strip the floorboards. WOMAN. You can't live without a floor. MAN. You can't live without a piano. She starts to dismantle the piano, opening the lid, taking it off it's hinges, it's heavy, she hands him the heavy lid and he reluctantly dumps it on the floor. WOMAN. It's my piano. MAN. I bought it for you. WOMAN. It needs tuning. Who's going to tune it? Can you tune it? They look at each other sadly. They take the front piece away and dump that. The WOMAN picks up the axe and hands it to the MAN. He swings it at the frame. END OF FLASHBACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN walks toward a tin shed and crosses the dead grass. He stops suddenly. He stamps about a bit, listening. He continues on into the shed. Beside the shed sits an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The man reappears, spade in hand. He digs the spade into the dead grass and hear's it CHOMP into wood. He digs more urgently, increasingly exhausted, until a door is revealed in the dirt. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is so engrossed he hasn't noticed the BOY standing a few feet away, watching with saucer eyes, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't open it, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It'll be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please, Papa, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No it's not! What if there's people hiding down there? The MAN ignores him, focussed as he chops the plywood around the lock, gets the spade under a corner and levers the door open. The BOY has his fists bunched up to his chest, bobbing up and down with fear. The MAN starts to descend a hand made wooden stair case in the bunker. He takes another disposable lighter from his pocket, gives the child a kiss on the forehead and then disappears into the bunker, leaving the worried BOY staring after him. The BOY looks around at the deserted yard as the evening draws in, now even more frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (O.O.V.) Oh my God... oh my God!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it, Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.O.V.) Come down. Oh my God come down. The BOY is in the hole and down the steps like lightning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - EVENING The little BOY CLATTERS down the steps. The MAN is busy lighting up candles. BOY. Papa? What did you find?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everything. I found everything. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stored in the bunker are crate upon crate of canned goods: tomatoes, peaches, beans, apricots, canned ham, corned beef, hundreds of gallons of water in ferry cans and in boxes paper towels, toilet paper and trash bags stuffed with blankets. The MAN takes the BOY's hand and helps him down, then goes back up the steps and draws the door shut and jams a pair of metal pliers through the heavy inside hasp to stop the door being opened. He goes back down the steps to the BOY and holds up a candle to illuminate the shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Can you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is all this stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's food! Can you read the labels? The BOY stares at the brightly colored packaging, he's never seen anything like it before. The MAN hands the BOY a tin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "Pears." It says "pears."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes! It does! Oh yes it does! Pears! They inspect the shelves: chilli, corn, stew, soup, spaghetti sauce, the BOY's eyes are like saucers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh yes, it's real all right. The MAN pulls a box of butane lighters from the shelf and tests one, it doesn't work. He tests another which works, it has a large flame - he uses it to read the labels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why is it here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Because someone thought it might be needed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But they died. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. What would you like for breakfast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (THINKS.) Pears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pears it is. The MAN claws open a box and pulls out a tin of pears. He gets paper bowls from a stack, plastic forks and spoons, lays them out. He finds a camping lamp. He puts a butane cannister in and lights up the lamp. He finds a can opener and opens the pears while the BOY watches silently, wrapping a blanket around himself and sitting on the soft bunk bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it okay for us to take it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They'd want us to. The MAN dishes up two bowls of pears and they sit side by side on the bunk with spoons and pears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) These will be the best pears you ever tasted. The best. You just wait. They eat in silence. They lick the spoons and drink the syrup from the bowls. The MAN feels inside his mouth with his fingers - the sugar irritating a sore tooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Too sweet. The BOY smiles, amused, and the MAN opens another tin. INT. BUNKER - (CAMP 12)- EVENING Ham and powdered eggs frying in a pan on the camping stove. The kettle is boiling on another ring of the gas stove. The BOY just stares at the bubbling food as the MAN cooks. Nearby a breakfast table is set out on a stack of boxes acting as a breakfast bar: biscuits, a plate of butter, condensed milk, salt and pepper plates and utensils. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN brings the pan over and forks over chunks of ham onto the pates, then spoonsfull of scrambled eggs from a second pan, then baked beans from a small pot. The BOY just stares, as if drugged, uncomprehending, the food alien to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go ahead. Don't let it get cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do I eat first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Whatever you like. The BOY eats a hunk of ham as the MAN pours coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is this coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's right. Careful it's hot. He hands him coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We did good, didn't we Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah, we did good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12)- NIGHT The MAN puts the BOY to bed in a bunk and smooths his filthy hair tenderly, smiling with relief, until the BOY shuts his eyes and nods off. He covers the BOY with a blanket and kisses him. He just sits watching the BOY sleep, suddenly on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - NIGHT The MAN folds the BOY's tiny clothes, noticing the bulging pockets of his pants. He empties them, creating a small pile of collected artefacts: a smooth stone, a marble, an old house key, bottle tops, a smooth, hand made Indian arrow head, fashioned from stone, lastly a broken piece of a woman's mother of pearl hair comb. By the BOY's bunk he unfolds the crayon drawing he's been working on and examines it, deeply moved: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - an eccentric, childlike drawing of the WOMAN, skinny like a stick figure but, inexplicably, with a brightly smiling face and big laughing eyes, labelled simply "mom" in spidery scrawl. Stirring classical music fades up and into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close in on a pair of LEGS in stockings, a summer dress, a WOMAN's hands holding a MAN's hand in her lap. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: feels the tops of the stockings with his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - the MAN is with the WOMAN in a concert theatre, at a recital. The WOMAN wears the mother of pearl hair comb. The seats are velvet, gold scrollwork adorns the boxes, an illustrious, fortunate world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - MORNING The BOY wakes blearily and immediately notices his collection of artefacts turfed out by the bed. Nearby the MAN is dressing as the BOY starts gathering up his collection crossly, especially protective of the arrow ahead - or just embarrassed. They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (TEASING BUT INDIGNANT.) Don't touch my stuff. EXT. LAWN - DAWN The hatch opens and the MAN's face appears, as he looks around. He opens the hatch more and clambers out with a couple of jerry cans of water, the yard is quiet. Next, the BOY's face pops up and peers around. He clambers out carrying a big pot with a camping stove in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They empty the jerry cans into the huge pot, light the stove and put the pot on the stove to heat the water. 65.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is in the bath, filthy and scrawny, as the MAN bathes him, rubbing him with soap, scrubbing an oily film of scum from his dirty neck to reveal clean pale skin underneath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nice and warm. He washes the BOY's hair, lathing water over him with the pot. He has a sudden thought:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the MAN watches unseen from the doorway as the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tenderly washes the BOY's hair - he is perhaps a year younger than at the start of the film - she appears lost in the task, enjoying it, chatting away to the BOY, momentarily unburdened. She sticks a finger in the BOY's ears, giving them a good soaping, which he likes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You could grow potatoes in these ears... INT. BATHROOM, TOWN HOUSE - DAY END FLASHBACK - now the MAN is in the tub, also scrawny and filthy, lost in thought as he soaps up - the BOY helps. INT. BATHROOM, TOWN HOUSE - DAY The MAN trims his beard off with scissors in a mirror. He lathers up with shaving cream and starts to shave with a plastic safety razor. When the MAN is done he turns to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wiping away the foam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How do I look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Weird. Won't you be cold? INT. BATHROOM, TOWN HOUSE - DAY Now the MAN is cutting the BOY's hair with kitchen scissors and a plastic comb. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY has a towel around his shoulders and long locks of hair decorate it. The MAN finishes, takes the towel off, wipes the BOY's neck and face with a flannel, holds up a mirror for the BOY to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I look funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - MORNING They sit on the bunk bed with a checkerboard between them sipping thick hot chocolate made with condensed milk from plastic mugs and concentrating on the board, their worn out, wet blue jeans drying on a drying rack in the back ground. They are both wearing new sweaters too big for them, plundered from the stores. The MAN watches the BOY fondly, absorbed in checkers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heavy rain slashes down on the lawn, already pools of water are flooding the lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - NIGHT A shiny new quart of whiskey is slipped from its paper liquor store bag and opened with a soft CRACK. The whiskey is poured into a glass with a satisfying GLUG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - another feast is laid out, ham and powdered mash potato and biscuits and gravy. The BOY is eating while the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pours a whiskey. The BOY stops eating to watch the MAN drink the whiskey. The MAN's eyes glaze as he sips the strong liquor, dizzy already. BOY. Can I try some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. You won't like it. Makes you feel funny. The BOY stares, curious, wanting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You think I come from another world, don't you? Filled with all these strange things you've never seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sort of. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, I do I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN just stands in the middle of the lawn COUGHING his guts up in the dark rain - again the phlemy wet cough. He bends over, sweating, listening, knowing it's the sound of fluid on the lungs. As he listens he hears something above the rain - he keeps shifting position, as if hearing different sounds from different directions. Nevertheless he anxiously looks around, then goes to the porch and drags an old mattress over, across the dead grass to the hatch. He lays it half across the hatch, crawls through the remaining gap and hauls the mattress the rest of the way over the hatch, then pulls the hatch closed with the old mattress lying on top. It just looks like an old mattress lying on a lawn in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - DAWN The MAN listens to the PATTER of rain and hears another sound... something or someone RUSTLING around the mattress above. He hears the sound of the MATTRESS being DRAGGED off of the door. He hears SCRABBLING and SCRATCHING on the door and freezes, staring at the lock, waiting for the inevitable... He quietly picks up the revolver. He looks across and sees the BOY is now wide awake too, staring, wide- eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) Maybe it's a dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPERS.) It's not a dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (BARELY MANAGING TO WHISPER.) It is! It's a dog! A dog! The MAN listens anxiously as the pawing and scratching continues, the wood over the bunker amplifying the noise. He cocks the revolver and positions himself under the hatch, ready. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If it's a dog it'll be with someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. After a torturous moment the sounds die away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I'm not waiting to find out. Come on. Let's get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know but it's not safe anymore. The MAN grabs his gun and cocks it, rushes about turning out all the lamps, and they sit anxiously in the darkness. EXT. LAWN - MORNING LATER - it's now lighter outside, the mattress lifts as the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the trap door and very carefully peeps out. He looks around, all angles, checking the coast is clear, then shuts the hatch again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 12) - MORNING The MAN starts loading cans and packets into a carton. He gathers a couple of large jerry cans of water. The BOY helps. BOY. What are we going to do with all this stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We'll just have to take what we can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I wish we could live here. And we could keep the dog and the dog could catch food for us. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Look, there is no dog, okay? I'm sorry but there just isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well what is it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know what it is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just say it's going to be all right, Papa. Say it. Just say it, please. The MAN doesn't know what to say, losing patience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Listen, trouble comes when you least expect it. So maybe the thing to do is to just always expect it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you always expect it? Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I do, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You always think bad things are going to happen but we found this place. Maybe we'll find another place like this at the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe. The MAN dumps the carton of food on the floor and packs another, organising jerry cans of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The INDUSTRIAL TROLLEY is loaded up and tied with a grey tarp. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We'll have to cover our tracks from now on. The MAN drags the old mattress back over the entrance to the bunker. He carefully covers the surrounding area with debris. EXT. RIVER - DAY The MAN pulls the new trolley across a bridge, stagnant black water underneath, the trolley is now laden with jerry cans of fresh water and cartons containing as many tins of food and supplies as they could manage. The BOY trails along behind. They are a strange sight, clean clothed, clean shaven, short haired, in their new jumpers - and now both wearing new surgical masks which they raise off their faces to speak. The MAN keeps checking behind him. POV MAN - he sees the glint of glass, perhaps a pair of BINOCULARS watching them. The BOY watches anxiously as the MAN gets out his own
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and looks through them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - a mysterious winking glint of light which quickly disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - through a different pair of binoculars, a completely different POV, we see the MAN looking through his binoculars at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think they're following us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You think it's bad guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Probably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What if it's good guys? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't think we're likely to meet any good guys for a while. We have to be careful now. We've got food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they round a bend in the road they see a hunched figure walking ahead of them. The MAN stops abruptly, gets out the binoculars and watches:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - a distant, hunched figure hobbling away from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come up behind an OLD MAN, hunched over, withered, silent as he hobbles ahead. He wears layers of torn clothing and his feet are wrapped in rags and cardboard tied with green twine. They slowly approach and the man stops, turns and watches them suspiciously as they draw level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't have anything for you. You can look if you want. I got nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're not robbers. The OLD MAN leans an ear forward, deaf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I said we're not robbers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're just like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you following me for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're not following you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We've got food we could give him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's not getting any food. The OLD MAN looks away, avoiding their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's scared, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everybody's scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN eyes the road to the left and right, then draws his revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) If this is an ambush, he goes first. He goes out to the trolley and rummages in it while the BOY and the OLD MAN stare at each other. The MAN comes back with a tin of fruit cocktail and a tin opener and opens it and hands it to the BOY. The BOY places the tin of fruit on the road in front of the OLD MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Take it. Here. The OLD MAN doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) What about a spoon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's not getting a spoon. The BOY urges him on, miming with his hands, as if feeding a raccoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eat it. It's good. The OLD MAN picks up the tin and his filthy long nails
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the tin as he tips it to his mouth, the juice running down his chin, his head jerking as he swallows. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Look, Papa. He's hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I see it. And I know what you're going to ask me. And the answer is No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's the question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We can't keep him. They watch him eating painfully slowly. The OLD MAN finishes and sits down in the road holding the tin, staring at it, as if it might refill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) When did you last eat? The OLD MAN just stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Do you want to eat with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. What do I have to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tell us where the world went.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't have to do anything. Can you walk okay? They help the OLD MAN off the road and hand him his cane but he pushes it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can walk. They walk off the road towards the dead, blackened woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they leave the road the OLD MAN studies the BOY. The BOY goes to take his hand: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (TO BOY.) Don't hold his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He can't see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't. The trio walk into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) How old are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm ninety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ninety my ass! Is that what you tell people? So they don't hurt you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Does it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just "Ely?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's wrong with "Ely?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 14) - EVENING There's a camp fire now. The OLD MAN sits wrapped in a quilt, eating with a spoon and-licking his plate clean. In the far distance, the faint glow of fires. The orange light bounces into the night sky eerily. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How come you're still alive? What do you eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. People give you things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No they don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I didn't. He did. The OLD MAN eyes the BOY, closely, half blind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are you a little boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What does he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. I can't see real good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is that right? Can you see me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. But I can tell somebody's there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TO BOY.) Okay. You need to sleep. Come on. He gathers up the BOY and takes him a few feet away, settles him down in blankets while the OLD MAN stares into the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I had a little boy once. Gone... all gone... MAN. What happened to him? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't... I can't talk about that... leastways not with you I can't. When the MAN returns he has his gun which he surreptitiously places on the ground in full view of the OLD MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You can see that, right? Okay. Tell me now. You're not a shill for a pack of road agents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm not anything. I'll go if you want me to. I can find the road. The MAN stares at the OLD MAN cynically but the OLD MAN just stares back blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I live like an animal. You don't want to know the things I've had to eat. When I saw that boy I thought I'd died and he was an angel. I never thought I'd see a child again. I never thought that would happen to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He is an angel. To me he's a God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well I hope that's not true. To be on the road with the last surviving God would be a pretty frightening experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why do you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where men can't live, Gods can't either. The road gangs would tear you limb from limb, both of you. The low RUMBLE in the earth is heard again, an earthquake, this time in the distance. They listen a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I knew this was coming. This or something like it. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) There were warnings. People thought it was a con - I always believed in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Did you try to get ready for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. What would you do? Even if you knew what to do you wouldn't know what to do. Suppose you were the last man left alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How would you know if you were the last man alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't guess you would know it. You'd just be it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe God would know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If there is a God up there he would have turned his back on us by now. Whoever made humanity will find no humanity here. The MAN pours hot water into mugs to make coffee, hands one to the OLD MAN. They drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you ever wish you would die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. It's foolish to ask for luxuries in times like these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 14) - MORNING The BOY and the OLD MAN are standing by the trolley. The MAN is watching from further away. The OLD MAN is fitting another can of peaches the BOY has given him into his knapsack. M You should thank him you know. I wouldn't have given you anything. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe I should and maybe I shouldn't. I wouldn't have given you anything. The OLD MAN looks around, orientating himself, and goes, tapping his cane, without a glance back at the BOY or the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The MAN gives the BOY a reproachful look and the BOY looks defiant for the first time, a new distance between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's going to die and you don't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I care enough. Maybe when we're out of food you'll have more time to think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You always say watch out for bad guys but that old man wasn't a bad guy and you can't even tell anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 13) - DAWN The MAN and the BOY are camped inside an old church, dusty, faded stained glass is the only colour, startling after all the monochrome. The MAN and BOY are wrapped up in blankets, a small fire going. The BOY is asleep but the MAN is awake, coughing. He sits up, still coughing. He gets up and walks outside, trying to stifle the coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 13) - DAWN He wanders into an antechamber, coughing uncontrollably, falls to his knees in a shroud of morning mist flooding the church - and coughs up a gob of something dark and nasty, spits it into the misty ground. POV MAN - the mist before him clears to reveal a spattering of dark blood on the pale ash. He stares, shocked, knowing what it signifies. INT. CHURCH - (CAMP 13) - DAWN The BOY opens his eyes, he hasn't been asleep, listening to the MAN cough, worried. The MAN returns and eyes the worried BOY. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's wrong? BOY. I had a bad dream. MAN. What about? BOY. I don't want to tell you. Just you. MAN. What happened to me? The BOY's face crinkles up, he starts to sob. The MAN coughs again and the BOY shoots out a hand, puts it over the MAN's mouth to staunch the coughing. MAN. (V.0.) (CONT'D) I tell him: When you dream about bad things happening it shows you're still fighting. You're still alive. It's when you start to dream about good things you should start to worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are trudging along the blacktop adjacent to a railway line. There is a SHOTGUN blast in the distance and the MAN and the BOY stop and look around. The MAN checks behind him instinctively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - a thin spike of smoke from a campfire rising up in the woods behind. The BOY notices and looks behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you think they're still following us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think they've been following us for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe it's Ely - the old man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How? On a broom stick? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY thinks about this for a moment as they approach the railway line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and the BOY are swaddled in blankets up amongst the rocks with a birds eye view of the road and a railway bridge they can see along the road and the dead trees for half a mile. The BOY is nodding off, his head lolling as the MAN keeps watch, increasingly paranoid. EXT. BLUFFS, BLACKENED LANDSCAPE (CAMP 16) MORNING As they come down from the bluffs, the MAN is staring into the dead woods where another thin stem of SMOKE is rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . More smoke. I think we should take a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to. Let's just keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Whoever it is I don't want them behind us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What if they're bad guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What if they're good guys? They look at each other, a stalemate. The MAN stands and starts to pack up the tarp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Look. Whoever it is out there, it's better to know about it than to not know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Because we don't like surprises. Surprises are scary. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) They could sneak up on us further down the road. You need to learn this. The MAN folds the tarp and sleeping blankets and starts heading down the slope to the trolley, the BOY following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A deserted campsite, a campfire, recently abandoned. The MAN and the BOY look around, disappointed. EXT. DUNES/COAST ROAD, BLACKENED LANDSCAPE - DAY Open country now, completely blackened landscape under heavy ash. They are stopped. The BOY unfolds the threadbare map on the ground, a crayon in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You know where we are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where do you think? The BOY points to a place on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) More.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. We're closer than you think. He takes the crayon and points on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) This is us. This is all sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it blue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The sea? I don't know. It used to be. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN picks up a desiccated pine cone from the ground, and stares at it, hollow-eyed, hungry. He squeezes it and it crumbles to dust. He takes a few steps, sniffing the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Can you smell that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It smells different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everything is going to be different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The landscape has changed, dead salt bush and sand at the side of the road and finally, as they come around a bend in the road: dead sea grass sloping up to sand dunes up ahead. They look at each other and head for the dunes excitedly. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hides the trolley discretely, so the BOY doesn't see his concern, he takes their bags, tarps and blankets with them as they head off for the dunes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - Gray beach, lead gray sea and waves rolling in slowly with a distant ROAR. On the beach a tide mark of wet gray ashy sludge and a skirt of glistening bones, fish skeletons bleached white on the sand. They take their parka hoods down and just stand there staring at the beach, the wind HOWLING around them, dozens of bleached WHALE and FISH BONES and SKELETONS OF HUMANS who have made it this far only to die. The MAN looks at the BOY and sees the intense disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm sorry it's not blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sit on the beach wrapped in blankets staring at a surreal wall of impenetrable smog not far beyond where the waves are breaking. The MAN eyes the silent BOY, buffeted by wind, wrapped in a blanket, staring at the empty ocean... there is nothing and nobody there. They keep staring out to sea, filled with disappointment. The BOY impassively surveys the wall of smog which is like an iron curtain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What's on the other side? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There must be something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maybe there's a father and his little boy and they're sitting on the beach too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And they could be carrying the fire too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They could be, yes. The MAN sees the BOY's hopefulness reappearing and strokes his head, his heart breaking for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN and the BOY stand with their shoes off, the black sea washes up the sand at their filthy, blistered feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are our long term goals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "What are our long term goals?" Where did you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. You said it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When your mother was here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And what was the answer? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, I don't either. They stare at the water - charred, quotidian household objects rolling back and forth in the surf. BOY. Can I go swimming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Swimming? You'll freeze your nuts off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to have to come in after you. The BOY lets the blanket fall and strips out of his parka and clothes. He runs along the beach naked, skinny and white, leaping SCREAMING into the icy surf. The MAN watches until the BOY comes out of the water, gasping with cold, shuddering. He wraps the BOY in the blanket and dries him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - EVENING The BOY is wrapped in blankets by the fire as LIGHTNING flickers in the distance, illuminating the empty beach. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drapes another blanket over them. He puts his arms around the BOY who is shivering and sweating, looking a little wild eyed, babbling a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How many people do you think are still alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In the world? I don't know. Not very many.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There could be people alive someplace else. Besides on earth? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't think so. They couldn't live any place else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Not even if they could get there? If they had a-a-a spaceship?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. It's unlikely. The BOY stares, shivering, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Are you all right? What is it? He cups his hand to the babbling BOY's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't feel so good. The BOY bends away and vomits and the MAN helps, rubbing his back and wiping the BOY's mouth when he's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's okay, you didn't do anything wrong. The MAN is very worried now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - LATER The MAN covers the BOY in more blankets and constructs a makeshift tent with the tarp as the rain falls all around. MAN. It's okay. You're going to be okay. It'll pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't leave me here, don't go away Papa. Not even for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I won't go away. I'm right here. He sits holding the BOY tightly. He feels for the BOY's heart. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops droplets of sugar water from a bowl into the BOY's mouth. As the BOY shuts his eyes and dozes he checks the pulse at his neck and wipes his mouth with the blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - NIGHT The BOY is sleeping fitfully across the MAN's lap - he is still awake, staring in horror as the BOY sweats and shakes in his sleep. He wipes the BOY's brow, looks up-to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh no. No no. Not this. Jesus Christ what have you done to us? What have you done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - MORNING The BOY is fast asleep, motionless but for stertorous breathing through his mouth. The MAN lies beside him, just staring at him, watching him sleep. The BOY opens his eyes and focuses weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hi Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know. The BOY shuts his eyes and goes back to sleep. The MAN strokes the BOY's hair tenderly, takes the pistol from his belt and carefully hides the pistol under the blanket by the boy's side. He stands, takes one last look and walks away... EXT. SPIT/WATER - DAWN The MAN is alone now, staring at the hull of a wrecked boat keeled over in ten feet of gray water a few yards out from the spit - a sixty footer, twin masts. Closer to shore, in the shallows between the boat and the sand is a grey, lifeless form. The man steps closer and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - bobbing about in the tide, the bloated, rotting cadaver of a giant squid, eyes like dinner plates, translucent grey skin like an old light bulb. The MAN eyes it uneasily, then starts stripping off his clothes. He stares anxiously into the darkly roiling water near the boat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks back along the beach to the distant figure of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting up wrapped in his blankets, looking around, confused and scared, enough to make the MAN wince. He collects himself and wades cautiously into the gray soupy water. He takes a breath and starts swimming to the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - DAY The BOY is confused as he watches:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - the MAN swimming away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 16) - EVENING MYSTERY POV - over the shoulder of a mystery third person, camera pushes in slightly on the BOY sleeping. EXT. SAND DUNES - (CAMP 16) - EVENING A FIGURE's feet enters the scene behind the boy, carefully walks in close around the boy. The FIGURE's long KNIFE drops into the scene, held at the figure's side. The BOY senses the FIGURE and wakes up to see: POV BOY - a dark, hunched FIGURE standing over him. The BOY looks up at the FACE and, whatever it is, he's terrified. The BOY SHRIEKS, terrified, scrambling away, tripping over pots and pans by the fire, he gets to his feet and runs. EXT. SHORELINE - EVENING The MAN struggles from the water and scans the beach, no sign of the BOY. He dumps a medical kit and flare pistol he's found on the boat and heads for the sand dunes. EXT. SAND DUNES - (CAMP 16) - EVENING The MAN runs over the sand and reaches the spot where he left the BOY, the blue tarp blowing away across the beach, the campsite and campfire disturbed. He runs up the dunes. EXT. BEACH - EVENING POV BOY - as he looks back he glimpses ragged FEET rushing through the sand after him, a pair of hands reaching out... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - he catches up with the BOY, grabs his shoulder with one hand and the gun with the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - the BOY sees it's the MAN and stops, stares, still frightened, feverish, wild-eyed, confused. MAN. It's okay - BOY. A man! There was a man! I saw a man. MAN. It's okay, he's gone now, it's just me. The BOY collapses, exhausted, into the MAN's arms. EXT. SAND DUNES - (CAMP 16) - NIGHT The MAN and the BOY return to examine the disturbed campsite. MAN. Oh Christ. You stupid ass! You stupid ass! BOY. What happened? MAN. He stole our shoes. He stole everything. The BOY goes quiet, forlorn, staring around at the desolation in despair. MAN. (CONT'D) What's wrong? BOY. I don't know what we're doing. MAN. Come here. BOY. I don't know why we're doing this. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Look, there are... (HE TRAILS OFF, LOST FOR WORDS.) There are people... there are other people and we'll find them. You'll see. The BOY just shuts his eyes and slumps onto the sand in despair. The MAN eyes him anxiously. MAN. (CONT'D) Please. Listen to me. Don't lose heart. The MAN seizes the FLARE GUN, takes it from its case hurriedly, loads it with shells - the BOY now watches, wide- eyed. The MAN rushes a few paces up the DUNE and looks over to where the trolley was hidden - he fires a FLARE into the air. The FLARE arcs up into the murk with a long WHOOSH and breaks in a cloud of light, hanging there, hot tendrils of magnesium drifting down to the sand. The BOY watches, curious despite his despair. The MAN strains his eyes to see: the dunes bathed in pink light from the flare and the sand pock-marked with the footprints of the STRANGE MAN in a trail leading to the spot where the trolley. The trolley marks trail off into the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - from a distance, a third party is watching the MAN and BOY bathed in the light of the flare. CAMERA pushes in on the FACE watching them - bearded and scarred with a wandering eye and a crushed cheekbone, a veteran of many skirmishes. EXT. SAND DUNES - NIGHT The MAN and the BOY stand in their bare feet. MAN. Come on. We have to get our shoes back. BOY. (FRIGHTENED, RELUCTANT.) We don't need them! MAN. We won't get far without them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They set off hurriedly, in their bare feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the road in the middle of a desolate landscape, the light is dying, the strange lattice of lightning flickering across the sky, the MAN and the BOY are barefoot on the tarmac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - way up ahead is the hunched FIGURE seen earlier - the THIEF, his back to us, trundling the loaded trolley along the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on. They take off after the thief, bare feet thudding on the tarmac, the MAN in front, the BOY trailing, trying to catch up. The THIEF looks back at them and speeds up, head bent down over the handle running for his life. When he looks back again the MAN has drawn his pistol and is aiming it directly at him. The THIEF stops the trolley, pulls a carving knife from his belt, and turns to face them, standing behind the trolley. His face is emaciated and twitchy, a mouth like a bombed grave yard - not the FACE of the man watching them in the sand dunes. The MAN trains his gun on him, stock still, holding the BOY's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Get away from the cart and put the knife down. The MAN spits and brandishes the knife desperately, he's scrawny, sullen, bearded and filthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) If you don't put down the carving knife and get away from the godamn cart I'm going to blow your brains out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Be quiet. The MAN cocks the pistol and there's two loud CLICKS. MAN. (CONT'D) God damn you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa please don't kill the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on man, I done what you said, listen to the boy. The BOY starts crying - the THIEF looks at the BOY and then the angry MAN, this seems to be sobering. He puts the knife in the trolley and steps away, hands in the air, his thumbs are missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How long have you been following us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I wasn't following you. I saw the cart on the sand an' I just took it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Take your clothes off. Take them off, every godamn stitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on man, don't do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll kill you where you stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't do this, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I won't tell you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All right, all right, just take it easy. The THIEF looks at the BOY who is now covering his ears and the MAN takes an intimidating step closer with the gun. The THIEF starts stripping and piling his rags in the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The shoes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The shoes. He sits naked in the road and unlaces the rotting shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Put them in the cart. The THIEF stands and drops the shoes in the trolley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Put the clothes in. The MAN drops the clothes in and stands there covering himself, shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't do me like this, man. You don't need to do me like this. MAN. You didn't mind doing it to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm begging you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on, listen to the kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You tried to kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm starving man. You'd have done the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You took everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll die out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm going to leave you the way you left us. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN grabs the trolley by the handle, pulls it around, puts the pistol on top and holds his hand out for the BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Let's go. The BOY doesn't take his hand but they set off along the blacktop, the BOY snivelling and crying, leaving the THIEF shivering and whimpering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do you think would have happened to him if we hadn't caught him? You've got to learn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want to learn!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I won't be here forever. Sooner or later you'll have to look after yourself. The BOY just looks at him - and keeps crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some distance away the BOY looks back at the THIEF, still crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You have to stop crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I can't. The BOY looks back one last time as the THIEF disappears from view - still just standing there, utterly lost. The MAN stops and puts his shoes on. He walks back up the road to the bend but the THIEF has gone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's gone. Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's not gone. He's not. The MAN looks helplessly at the tearful BOY as he fits his shoes on for him, the tears streaking the soot on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What do you want to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just help him, Papa. Just help him. The MAN looks back down the road, weighing it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) He was just hungry Papa. He's going to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's going to die anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's so scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm scared. Do you understand? I'm scared. The MAN tries to look the BOY in the eye but he keeps his head bowed, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You're not the one who has to worry about everything. The BOY mumbles, tearful and snotty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) What? What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes I am. I am the one. The MAN stops and faces-the innocent BOY angrily, stares, then relenting, summons all his strength, turns the trolley around and they start wheeling it back the way they came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All right. Help me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN takes the BOY's hand and puts it on the trolley handle. EXT. ROAD/COAST, BLACKENED LANDSCAPE - NIGHT As the light fades to darkness they look for the THIEF to give him his clothes back and call out "Hallo!" Etc. After a moment they stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's afraid to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is this where we stopped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know. I think so. They keep walking, hands cupped to mouths, hallooing mindlessly. The MAN stops to rest and watches the BOY a moment, he has stopped crying as he calls out for the thief. Finally the MAN piles the THIEF's shoes and clothes in the road. He puts a rock on top of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Come on. We have to go. The BOY eyes the clothes sadly, silent now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They find a spot to stop and sit, exhausted. The MAN opens the first aid kit he took from the boat, selects various pills, crushes them up, pours a cup of water from a ferry can in the trolley, and hands them to the BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want it. MAN. I have to get your temperature down. The BOY swallows the pills and the water, shivering. BOY-. Can I ask you something? MAN. Of course you can. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What would you do if I died? MAN. If you died I'd want to die too. BOY. So you could be with me? MAN. So I could be with you, yes. But that's not going to happen. They look at each other a moment, unsure, the BOY shivering and sick-looking. The BOY lies down and shuts his eyes. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puts a blanket over him. The MAN walks away a few paces and coughs endlessly, a nagging cough that won't go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a dream and a memory of an early summer day, the MAN and the WOMAN are in an orchard, lying in the sun on a picnic blanket, an array of food, bread, fruit and wine beside them. The MAN lies back and the WOMAN cradles his head in her lap, stroking his brow. She brings her face down and gently plants a simple kiss on each of his eyelids, then on each of his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - the WOMAN's face, smiling a dazzling, radiant smile, framed by sunlight and the indistinct shapes of leaves and blossom and petals against the sky - to him she is angelic. Then he kisses her on each eye and on the lips too - their ritual caress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN awakes distressed, he wipes a tear, blinks in confusion. POV MAN - the BOY is kneeling beside him, watching him calmly, no longer sweating and shivering, recovered. BOY. Papa? The MAN rouses himself, sits up and just stares at the BOY, amazed, as if he has arisen from the grave MAN. How are you feeling? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I feel kind of weird. MAN. Are you hungry? BOY. Just thirsty. The MAN gets up and fetches water from a ferry can in the trolley, pours a cup, hands it to the BOY who drinks thirstily. The MAN reaches out and strokes the BOY's hair as he drinks. EXT. RESORT TOWN, OUTSKIRTS - DAY The MAN and the BOY head towards a seaside town off in the distance. EXT. RESORT TOWN - DAY They enter a small beach resort with a faded "Welcome" sign across the road, the BOY holding the MAN's hand now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are down by the water. Small pleasure boats are half sunken in the grey water. Faded colored bunting and painted signs advertise ICE CREAMS, FOOD and a FUN FAIR. The BOY helps the man push the trolley through the sand until they can go no further, they stop and drop onto the sand, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can I tell you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You tell me I shouldn't cry but I've heard you crying. I hear you coughing and crying to yourself in the night when you think I'm asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So if I shouldn't cry you shouldn't cry either. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the port side of town the MAN wheels the trolley through the deserted docks past rotten piers, a row of empty wooden warehouses and a rusty red tanker washed up. He is COUGHING and the sound echoes off the warehouse walls. The BOY is trailing a few paces behind, they're not speaking now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they pass the last of a row of deserted warehouses the MAN slows down to let the BOY catch up. But the BOY is now studying the ground intently. He bends down and picks up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOY - an old cardboard match box, it's decals faded. He pushes the match box open to reveal a perfectly preserved Beetle. BOY. What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's a Beetle. Suddenly the beetle twitches, then activates its wings and flies out of the box with a BUZZ and upwards into the sky... The BOY and the MAN stare up at the flying creature, amazed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without warning something WHISTLES over their heads very close and hits the wall beside them with a loud CLATTER. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lunges at the BOY, landing on top of him to cover him and tries to grab the trolley which tips over, spilling everything out. The MAN desperately tries to take cover while he looks over his shoulder and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAN - in the upper window of a warehouse a man is drawing a bow and arrow aimed right at them. In desperation the MAN covers the BOY and tries to scrabble away but there's a DULL TWANG of bowstring and an arrow THUDS into his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Oh you bastard! You bastard! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN claws the blankets from the upturned trolley aside and scrabbles around for the pistol but it has fallen from his belt onto the cobbles and scattered out of reach. He spots the flare gun and seizes it, resting it on the trolley and aiming carefully at the empty window. When the lone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears again he squeezes off a shot and the flare goes rocketing up towards the window in a firey arc, ablaze with color, clean through the window. They can hear the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inside and see the colored light still flaring from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh Papa!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stay just like you are. He gets up and runs limping across the street, the arrow still embedded in his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He limps up the stairs of the old warehouse as quickly as he can, flare gun at the ready, arrow in his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bursts into the main room and trains the gun. At the far end a WOMAN is sitting with the prone form of the ARCHER. The floor is burnt in a huge patch left by the flare and is still in flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You son of a bitch! MAN. Who else is up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You fucking asshole! The MAN looks down, his leg is bleeding heavily now and the arrow is still sticking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where's the bow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why are you following us? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're not following anybody. You were following us! The MAN stares at the WOMAN, looking her up and down, she looks sick and thin and desperate. He looks at the ARCHER, lying there dead, his chest and one arm and his face burnt, still smoking. The WOMAN covers his face with the blanket and the MAN doesn't know what to say, ashamed. He goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - again from a distance, as if a third party is watching, we watch the BOY and the MAN hobble into a CAFE. INT. CAFE - DAY One wall of the CAFE is merely a pile of rubble, opening out to the sea. The opposite wall is a photographic mural of lush green woods. The MAN tries to pull the arrow out but just pulls the wooden stem out. He takes off his bloodied trousers and examines the gaping wound with a flap of flesh and the arrow head, made from a SPOON, buried inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . See if you can find the medical kit from the boat. Quickly. The BOY rummages in the trolley, finds the kit and hands it over. He stares as the MAN slowly extracts the spoon, wincing in agony. The MAN dowses the wound in antiseptic from the kit and searches through the kit for a needle. He finds a suture needle in a sterile envelope, rips it open with his teeth and, using the light coming in through the parlour windows he threads some silk thread into the needle. He starts to suture up the wound, grimacing in pain as the BOY watches in silence, until eventually offering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it hurt? The MAN just looks at him in disbelief - beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes! It hurts!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What does it feel like? The MAN eyes the BOY, amazed at this inopportune chat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . At least you're talking to me now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 17) - NIGHT They have a campfire in the cafe by the jetty and sit overlooking the bay, through the missing wall, silent until: MAN. Do you want me to tell you a story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Your stories aren't true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They don't have to be true. They're stories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In the stories we're always helping people. But we don't help people. We just shoot people. And in the stories good things happen but we just get sick. The MAN thinks about it - stuck for an answer. MAN. We're still here aren't we? Doesn't that mean anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN pulls the trolley slowly, finding it a great effort. The BOY helps pull, eying the MAN with concern. The MAN stops and rests on the trolley and the BOY pulls on a few more feet then stops and looks back as the MAN COUGHS for a long painful moment. He takes the bloodstained surgical mask from his face, his breath foggy in the cold, he wrings out the blood and saliva, puts his head between his knees and coughs until he can cough no more, gasping for breathe, bloody drool unspooling from his lips into the sand like scarlet twine while the BOY watches, weeping silently. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We have to leave the cart. I can't push it anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are trudging along a concrete boat ramp by the beach road, the beach below, the BOY carrying a small-suitcase now, the MAN carrying sacks and bags. They stop and the MAN leans, impossibly breathless, his lungs packing up. They stop at the water edge, where the road reaches the sea. The BOY takes his hand gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are we going to do Papa? The MAN can't answer for breathlessness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Well, what are we? The MAN sits heavily on the ground, totters as the BOY stands watching him, eyes welling with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Oh no, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN is drifting in and out of consciousness in the sand. The BOY comes over with a cup of water and holds it to the MAN's lips, he drinks. The BOY has also lit a fire. He spreads out blankets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Don't get comfortable. You need to keep going. You don't know what might be down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No.
direction.name: direction
