direction.raw_text: . We were always lucky. You'll be lucky again. You'll see. Just go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. I can't. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's all right. This has been a long time coming. Just keep going south. Do everything the way we did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. You're going to be okay Papa. You have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Keep the gun with you at all times. Don't let anyone take it from you. You need to find the good guys but you can't take any chances. Do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I want to be with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I want to be with you too but I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You have to go off on your own now. You have to carry the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know how to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes you do. You know everything about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is it real? The fire? Papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where is it? I don't know where it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes you do. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's inside you. It was always there. I can see it. The BOY stares at him, not sure what to believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You have to let me go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just take me with you please. Please, Papa! What should I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just hold my hand. The BOY grips the MAN's hand, bouncing up and down, agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You said you wouldn't ever leave me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I know. I'm sorry. The BOY falls on the MAN, hugging him tight, face pressed to his chest, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) My boy. You have my whole heart. You always did. You're the best guy. You can talk to me and I'll talk to you. You'll see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How will I hear you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You just will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You just have to practice. Just don't give up okay? You'll be okay. You're going to be lucky. I know you are. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAN closes his eyes and takes deep, rattling breaths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's okay Papa. You don't have to talk anymore. Camera pulls back and the BOY is sitting with the MAN saying nothing. It's starting to grow dark. The BOY crouches down on the MAN's chest and goes to sleep there, rising and falling with his father's breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darkness all around, the BOY is lying across the MAN, his hand rising and falling on the MAN's chest slowly, irregularly as the MAN's breath rattles in his lungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: or the MAN'S last ever dream: The MAN and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: snooze in the car - an ordinary young couple nestled together in the early morning sun light. The MAN wakes and looks at his sleeping wife, smooths her hair tenderly, very much in love, as she sleeps. His hand on her wakes her, she looks at him surprised and pleased, smiles. WOMAN. Hello... She kisses him and they look at the blue ocean and the white sand and green sea grass and she puts an arm around him. MAN. (V.O.) If I were God I would have made the world just so and no different... And so I have you. .I have you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BEACH/DUNES - (CAMP 18) MORNING The BOY is awake but doesn't move, his hand still on the MAN's chest, now motionless. He looks at the MAN who is cold and stiff now, long dead. The BOY gets up and holds the MAN's cold stiff hand. Tears course down his face silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh Papa. Papa. Papa...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 18) NIGHT The BOY is building a campfire. He lights it and sits there watching the MAN's motionless body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY has slept beside the MAN, he wakes, blinks, bewildered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 18) - DAY The BOY is zipping up the MAN's parka carefully and heaping blankets on top, talking all the while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can I tell you something? I had a bad dream. I had this penguin that you wound up and it would waddle and flap its flippers. And we were in that house we used to live in and it came around the corner but nobody had wound it up and it was really scary because-because- because... He goes quiet as he finishes tending to the body and puts his own parka on, zips it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) The winder wasn't turning. He takes the gun, checks the magazine, shuts it and stands, shoving the pistol in his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY is standing at the water's edge looking out at the smog and the emptiness. Out of nowhere a man in a gray and red ski parka with the hood up appears carrying a shotgun over his shoulder and a belt of shells. He goes over to the BOY, he is the same bearded and scarred man seen earlier, watching them in the sand dunes. The BOY doesn't flinch, but his hand goes to the gun at his side. When the man speaks he has some sort of speech defect, possibly caused by missing teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where's the man you were with? (NO
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .) Was he your father? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. He was my Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't know what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, I think maybe you should come with me. The BOY's finger tightens on the trigger of the GUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are you one of the good guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah. I'm one of the good guys. Why don't you put that pistol away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'm not supposed to let anybody take the pistol. No matter what.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want your pistol. I just didn't want you pointing it at me. The BOY lowers the gun to his side and the VETERAN comes a few steps closer, causing the BOY to back up a step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) Where's your stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't have much stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What have you got? Blankets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . My Papa's wrapped in them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Show me. The BOY doesn't move. The MAN holds out his hand for the BOY to take, the BOY sees he has a THUMB MISSING and hesitates, wary. The MAN squats, leaning on his shotgun. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Look. You got two choices here. You can stay here with your papa or you can go with me. If you stay you need to keep off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How do I know you're one of the good guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't. You'll have to take a shot. The BOY weighs it up, eyeing the VETERAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you have any kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes we do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you have a little boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We have a little boy and a little girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How old is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's about your age. Maybe a little older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And you didn't eat them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't eat people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. We don't eat people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are you carrying the fire? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Am I what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carrying the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You're kind of weirded out, aren't you, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Well, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yeah. I am. I'm carrying the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And I can go with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes, you can. The BOY hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They go over to where the MAN lies dead and the VETERAN squats and lifts a blanket to take a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Are these all the blankets you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Is that your suitcase?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. The VETERAN stands and studies the BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Why don't you go up onto the road and wait for me. I'll bring the blankets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What about my Papa? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We can't just leave him here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes we can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I don't want people to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nobody to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can I cover him in leaves?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The wind will blow them away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Could we cover him with one of the blankets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay. I'll do it. Go on now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BOY waits and in a moment the VETERAN emerges from the dunes carrying the suitcase with the blankets slung over his shoulder. He sorts through them and hands one to the BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Here. Wrap this around you. You're cold. The BOY eye the blanket uncertainly, holds out the pistol for the VETERAN to hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) You hold onto that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Do you know how to shoot it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What about my papa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's nothing else to be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I think I want to say goodbye to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Will you be all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go ahead. I'll wait here for you. The BOY turns around and heads down to the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CAMP 18) - DAY The BOY trudges through the sand over to the corpse of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which is now neatly wrapped up in a blanket from head to toe. The BOY kneels beside him and starts to cry silently and whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'll talk to you every day. And I won't forget. No matter what. No matter what, Papa. The BOY dries his eyes, takes a breath, gets up and walks back to the road...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BOAT LAUNCH, ROAD- DAY As the BOY walks out of the dunes holding the gun, a MOTHERLY WOMAN who is standing with the VETERAN comes towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Oh. I am so glad to see you. The BOY just stares at her, bemused - a short distance away stands the rest of the family - a BOY his age and a GIRL. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at the OTHER BOY and recognizes him - it's the same BOY he chased earlier. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then the BOY notices a threadbare mongrel of a DOG, waiting with them. The MOTHERLY WOMAN goes over and puts her arms around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONT'D) We've been following you. Did you know that? We saw you with your Papa and we tried to catch up but you were too quick for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There was some discussion about whether to even come after you at all. As she's chatting, the MOTHERLY WOMAN gently takes the gun from the BOY and hands it to the VETERAN.
direction.name: direction
